tool_description: Welcome to our e-commerce API! Our API is designed to make it easy for you to build and manage your online store and also build projects you can show on your porfolio. With our API, you can create products, manage orders, track shipments, and more. Our API is built on modern technologies and is easy to integrate with your existing systems.  Our API provides a secure and reliable platform for your e-commerce needs. You can trust us to keep your data safe and secure. We also provide a range of ...
name: Cartify
title: Cartify

api_list.name: getOrders
api_list.description:
The endpoint retrieves all orders.

Set the authorization to "Bearer admin" to authorize that the admin can check and confirm all orders.

You should get a JSON object with the following attributes;
id (integer): The unique identifier for the order.
deliveryDate(Date): The date that the user wants the order to be delivered
destination(String): Location
Alongside with the user who ordered the product
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://cartify.p.rapidapi.com/users/api/v1/admin/orders"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "cartify.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

url = "https://cartify.p.rapidapi.com/users/api/v1/admin/orders"

        }

print(response.json())

api_list.name: getProducts
api_list.description:
This endpoint gets all products in the database.

A list of products in the store, with the following attributes:

id (integer): The unique identifier for the product.
title (string): The name of the product.
category (string): A description of the product.
price (number): The price of the product.
image_url (string): A URL to an image of the product.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://cartify.p.rapidapi.com/products"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "cartify.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getProductByName
api_list.description:
This endpoint filters through the products database and brings out results based on the preferences you want.

For a valid response, it takes a path parameter which is required which takes the name of the product you would want.

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "cartify.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getProductByCategory
api_list.description:
Do you want to search for a product by category?
Use the category of the product in the path parameter.

For example,
Are you looking for Phones? Use Phones in your path parameter

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "cartify.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getOrdersbyEmail
api_list.description:
For a valid response, fill in the email of the user in the path parameter. This is helpful instead of looping from the userId since the users can't have or use the same email. To also verify that it is an authenticated user trying to get his/her order, fill in an authorization header that takes the token of the user.....
For example, 
"Bearer <access_token>

api_list.name: getAllUsers
api_list.description: For a valid response, you would need to have an authorization header and set the role to *Bearer admin*.

api_list.name: addProduct
api_list.description:
This endpoint first verifies if the admin has permission to add a product by using a middleware function. You can do this by changing the permission of the authorization to "Bearer admin".

The admin can add the title, price, image, and category of the product.

The title takes a String
The price takes a number
The image takes a string(which can be gotten from the device that has the pictures you would use}
The category takes a String
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://cartify.p.rapidapi.com/products"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "cartify.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: userPayment
api_list.description:
This uses a simple stripe authentication to make payments. The endpoint firstly checks if there is a user that has been created with their platform. 

The Stripe API is used to create a new customer with the given email and payment source. The payment method is then retrieved for the customer. If there is no active payment method, an error is thrown. Otherwise, a new charge is created with the specified amount, description, currency, customer ID, and receipt email.

To use the endpoint, you would need to post the following data;
name, amount, orderId, and use the email for the path parameter

For StripeEmail: Use the email of the user who has placed the order on the goods so as to receive receipts with their mail.

For the Stripe Token: use "tok_visa".

For name: use the name of the user who has placed his order,

For orderId: It refers to the unique id of the order.

In your Authorization Header, use Bearer with the token of the logged in user
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://cartify.p.rapidapi.com/users/api/v1/orders/mj@gmail.com/pay"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "cartify.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: addOrderstoUsersCart
api_list.description:
This endpoint basically adds orders to the users' cart by using the path parameter UserId which is the id of the user that has ordered. It has a middleware function that uses the authorization header to verify the users' tokens before adding orders to the users' cart.
For a valid response, you would have to provide the userId to the path parameter.
It also takes the following parameters in the body ;
"productId",  "deliveryDate" and "destination"

api_list.name: usersSignUp
api_list.description: It takes a post response of three required fields; email, password, and username. The username can't be less than 8 characters.

api_list.name: userLogin
api_list.description:
This API allows registered users to authenticate themselves by providing their email addresses and password. 

If the credentials provided are incorrect or the user does not exist, it will return the status code error, 400. 
If the credentials are correct, it would return the status code, 200. 

This endpoint provides each user with a token to have access to place orders, delete orders, update orders, and more.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://cartify.p.rapidapi.com/users/api/login"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "cartify.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
